page.title: 10Blackpool Airport
page.content: Blackpool Airport has three runways and is the principial terminal for the Isle of Man and other Irish sea routes.It is the busiest light aviation airport in the country.Helicopters are now an important part of the day to day activities of the airport,as it is the main base for the off-shore gas field. Blackpool Airport is situated on the Fylde coast between the towns of Blackpool and Lytham St.Annes,both of which are well known tourist centres and holiday resorts. Transport links serving the airport include rail,road,bus and tramcar.The rail link is from Preston which is a major junction for services to the North,South and East,and serves Blackpool North Station,and Blackpool South Via Kirkham.
